220 cases are confirmed and no (0) cases are presumptive
Four (4) of the cases were tested in out-of-province laboratories over the past few weeks. This inclusion is part of routine surveillance case counting processes.
Six (6) of the cases are individuals in the zero to 19-year-old category; all others are adults, with 55% of the cases are males and 45% are females
102 of cases are travel-related, 52 are either contacts or linked to a mass gathering event, 10 have no known exposures and 56 are under investigation by local public health
A total of three (3) individuals are hospitalized; including two (2) inpatient hospitalizations and one (1) in ICU hospitalizations
Three (3) Saskatchewan residents with COVID-19 have died
A total of forty-eight (48) individuals have recovered
To date, 12,112 COVID-19 tests have been performed in Saskatchewan
